episodeTitle: Obtain the Five Keys! The Straw Hat Pirates vs. CP9!
description: After the Rocketman crashes into the Tower of Justice, Fukurou reveals that one of the CP9 members has the key to Robin's seastone handcuffs. The Straw Hats and Franky split up to battle each CP9 agent to find the correct key, while Spandam escapes with Robin deeper into Enies Lobby.

events.title: Rocketman Crashes into Tower of Justice
events.description: The Rocketman sea train carrying the Straw Hats and their allies crashes directly into the front wall of the Tower of Justice, creating a massive entrance. The entire crew emerges from the wreckage unharmed, ready to rescue Robin.
events.significance: This dramatic entrance marks the beginning of the climactic battles at Enies Lobby's Tower of Justice, demonstrating the crew's determination to rescue Robin regardless of the consequences.

events.title: Franky Rescues Kokoro, Chimney, and Gonbe
events.description: Franky pulls Kokoro, Chimney, and her pet rabbit Gonbe from the wreckage of the Rocketman after the crash. Despite the violent impact, everyone has survived relatively unscathed.
events.significance: Shows Franky's protective nature and ensures all allies are accounted for before the battles begin.

events.title: Fukurou Reveals the Five Keys Challenge
events.description: CP9 member Fukurou appears and reveals that Robin wears seastone handcuffs that nullify Devil Fruit powers. He announces that one of five CP9 members carries the correct key, while the other four have decoys, forcing the Straw Hats to battle each agent to find the right one.
events.significance: This revelation creates the strategic framework for the upcoming CP9 battles, raising the stakes by requiring the crew to defeat multiple powerful opponents rather than just pursuing Robin directly.

quotes.text: One of us has the real key to Robin's handcuffs, but you'll have to defeat all of us to find out which one!
quotes.speaker: Fukurou
quotes.context: Fukurou explaining the key challenge to the Straw Hats

events.title: Fukurou Demonstrates Rokushiki Techniques
events.description: Fukurou uses Soru (high-speed movement) and Geppo (air walking) to escape from the Straw Hats before they can stop him, demonstrating the superhuman abilities of CP9 members.
events.significance: Showcases the Rokushiki martial arts techniques that all CP9 members possess, establishing the level of combat ability the crew will face.

events.title: Sanji Develops the Battle Strategy
events.description: Sanji proposes a strategic plan: Luffy will pursue Spandam and Robin alone since he's the fastest, while the remaining six crew members (including Franky) will split up through the Tower to engage the five CP9 members holding keys.
events.significance: This strategic decision shapes the entire structure of the Enies Lobby battles, creating the one-on-one matchups that will define this arc.

quotes.text: Luffy, you go after Robin. The rest of us will handle CP9 and find the keys.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji organizing the crew's battle strategy

events.title: Franky vs Fukurou Matchup Begins
events.description: Franky searches for a kitchen to refuel on cola before fighting. He encounters Fukurou in a kitchen corridor, beginning their confrontation. Franky needs cola to restore his fighting capabilities.
events.significance: Establishes the first major one-on-one battle matchup between Franky and Fukurou, one of the stronger CP9 members.

events.title: Nami vs Kumadori Matchup Begins
events.description: In a dungeon-like hallway, Nami encounters Kumadori, who performs an elaborate kabuki-style introduction by stomping his staff on the ground. Nami confronts him about his key to Robin's handcuffs.
events.significance: Sets up the battle between Nami and the theatrical CP9 agent Kumadori, testing Nami's combat abilities against a Rokushiki user.

events.title: Kumadori's Kabuki Performance
events.description: Kumadori demonstrates his theatrical kabuki-inspired fighting style and mannerisms, incorporating traditional Japanese theater elements into his character presentation.
events.significance: Showcases Oda's incorporation of Japanese cultural elements (kabuki theater) into character design and personality, adding depth to the CP9 roster.

events.title: Sogeking vs Jabra Matchup Discovery
events.description: Sogeking (Usopp in disguise) explores different rooms in the Tower and discovers Jabra sleeping in a garden room. He spots key #1 lying out in the open, creating an opportunity to retrieve it without fighting.
events.significance: Creates dramatic tension as Sogeking must decide whether to attempt stealth or prepare for combat against the wolf Zoan user Jabra.

events.title: Sanji vs Kalifa Matchup Begins
events.description: Sanji enters a bathhouse room and is immediately locked in by Kalifa. She offers him tea, and despite knowing she's an enemy, Sanji is captivated by her beauty and accepts, showcasing his weakness around women.
events.significance: Highlights Sanji's character flaw regarding his inability to harm women, which will become a critical problem in this battle against the female CP9 member.

quotes.speaker: Kalifa
quotes.context: Kalifa offering tea to Sanji in the bathhouse

events.title: Sanji Teaches Proper Tea Preparation
events.description: Despite being in enemy territory, Sanji takes time to instruct Kalifa on the proper method of preparing tea, demonstrating his refined culinary knowledge and gentlemanly behavior even in battle situations.
events.significance: Reinforces Sanji's character traits as a skilled cook and gentleman, even when facing a dangerous opponent.

events.title: Zoro vs Kaku Matchup in the Library
events.description: Zoro encounters Kaku in the Tower's library. With his swords already drawn, Zoro declares that his blades are 'thirsty for blood,' establishing the serious tone of their upcoming battle.
events.significance: Sets up the swordsman battle between Zoro and Kaku, who is also skilled in blade combat and will later reveal his Giraffe Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.text: My swords are thirsty for blood.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro confronting Kaku in the library

events.title: Spandam Escapes with Robin and Lucci
events.description: Spandam drags Robin away from the main Tower area, heading toward the Gates of Justice with Rob Lucci as his personal guard. He orders CP9 to massacre the invaders while he makes his escape.
events.significance: Escalates the urgency of the situation as Robin is taken closer to the Gates of Justice, beyond which rescue would be nearly impossible.

events.title: Chimney and Gonbe Discover Secret Passageway
events.description: While the adults prepare for battle, young Chimney and her pet rabbit Gonbe discover a hidden secret corridor that Spandam, Lucci, and Robin used to escape. They begin following the passage undetected.
events.significance: This discovery will later prove crucial for Luffy to reach Robin, as Chimney will show him the secret route. It demonstrates how unexpected allies can provide vital assistance.

events.title: Seastone Handcuffs Explained
events.description: The episode reveals that Robin is wearing seastone handcuffs, which completely neutralize Devil Fruit powers. This explains why she cannot use her Hana Hana no Mi abilities to escape, making physical rescue by the crew essential.
events.significance: Provides important world-building information about seastone's properties and explains why a powerful Devil Fruit user like Robin cannot simply free herself.

events.title: Luffy Navigates Tower Maze
events.description: Luffy runs through a confusing maze of corridors and staircases within the Tower of Justice, trying to catch up to Spandam and Robin. The Tower's complex layout creates obstacles in his pursuit.
events.significance: Shows the physical challenges of the Tower of Justice's architecture and builds tension as Luffy races against time.

quotes.text: One of us has the real key to Robin's handcuffs, but you'll have to defeat all of us to find out which one!
quotes.speaker: Fukurou

quotes.text: Luffy, you go after Robin. The rest of us will handle CP9 and find the keys.
quotes.speaker: Sanji

quotes.text: My swords are thirsty for blood.
quotes.speaker: Zoro

themes.description: The Straw Hats demonstrate their willingness to face the World Government's most dangerous agents to rescue their friend Robin, showing the depth of their bonds.
themes.symbolism: The crashed Rocketman represents the crew's unstoppable determination to save Robin regardless of obstacles.

themes.description: The episode balances Luffy's impulsive desire to rush after Robin with Sanji's strategic planning to handle the CP9 threat systematically.
themes.symbolism: The five keys represent the multiple challenges and obstacles that must be overcome through both strength and intelligence.

themes.description: Kumadori's kabuki-inspired character design and mannerisms showcase traditional Japanese theatrical arts.
themes.symbolism: Kumadori's kabuki performance represents the blend of traditional Japanese culture with modern storytelling.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji takes on a leadership role by developing the battle strategy, showcasing his tactical thinking. However, his weakness around women is also highlighted when he encounters Kalifa.
keyActions: Proposes the strategic plan to split up and fight CP9
Teaches proper tea preparation despite the battle situation
quotes: Luffy, you go after Robin. The rest of us will handle CP9 and find the keys.

characterSpotlights.development: Fukurou serves as the messenger who explains the five keys challenge, setting up the battle framework. His loud mouth and tendency to reveal information become plot-important.
keyActions: Reveals the five keys challenge to the Straw Hats
Escapes to prepare for battle with Franky
quotes: One of us has the real key to Robin's handcuffs, but you'll have to defeat all of us to find out which one!

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being a young child, Chimney proves resourceful by discovering the secret passageway, setting up her future importance in the arc.
keyActions: Discovers the secret corridor to the Gates of Justice
Begins following Spandam and Robin undetected

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on Chimney and Gonbe discovering the secret passageway and following Spandam. In the manga (Chapters 403-404), this is only briefly mentioned rather than shown in detail.
Luffy's extended navigation through the Tower of Justice maze is anime-original padding. The manga shows him more quickly reaching his destination.

trivia.fact: Episode 285 primarily adapts Chapter 400 of the manga, with some content from Chapters 403-404 added.
This is the first episode to explicitly establish the five keys challenge, which becomes the framework for all the major CP9 battles throughout the Enies Lobby arc.

sources.title: Enies Lobby Arc - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: One Piece stopped using ending theme songs starting from Episode 279, so Episode 285 only features the opening 'Crazy Rainbow' by Tackey & Tsubasa. Ending songs didn't return until Episode 1071.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The episode was directed by Takahiro Imamura with screenplay by Koga Naoki, and features art direction by Miyuki Sato and Kumiko Fukuzawa.
The eyecatcher illustrations for this episode feature Luffy and Zoro, emphasizing the main combat focus of the Enies Lobby battles.
